arm_group.description: Subjects will be taped in at the ankle for a series of exercises.

brief_summary.textblock:
The main goal of this study is to evaluate the effect of taping on postural control during
      dynamic exercises. 30 subjects with Chronic ankle instability (CAI) will be included in the
      study. Several questionnaires regarding anthropometric data, medical history, activity level
      and functional status will be filled in by the participants. Postural control will be
      measured using a force plate and an optoelectronic system to capture lower limb kinematics.
      Subjects will be asked to perform a forward hop, sideward hop and a vertical drop, and they
      have to maintain their balance for 10 seconds after landing. 5 good trials of each movement
      will be captured. Subjects with CAI will perform these exercises with and without tape.
      Hypothesis is that subjects with CAI that tape will enhance postural control.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Taping on Postural Control in Subjects With Chronic Ankle Instability

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  a history of at least one ankle sprain which resulted in pain, swelling and
             stiffness, prohibiting participation in sport-, recreational or other activities for
             at least 3 weeks

          -  repeated ankle sprains

          -  presence of giving way

          -  feeling of weakness around the ankle

          -  a decreased functional participation (recreational, competitive or professionally)

        Exclusion Criteria:

intervention.description: Subjects will be taped in at the ankle for performing several exercises.

clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Taping on Postural Control in Subjects With Chronic Ankle Instability (CAI).

primary_outcome.description: Postural control will be measured using a force plate and an optoelectronic system to capture lower limb kinematics.
primary_outcome.measure: Immediate postural control with tape on ankle.
primary_outcome.time_frame: for 75 minutes, the duration of the exercises.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation will be done using a VAS scale.
secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective evaluation of the effect of taping on pain
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after the exercises (which last approximately 75 minutes).

secondary_outcome.description: This will be evaluated by interviewing the subject.
secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective evaluation of the effect of taping on difficulty level.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after the exercises (which last approximately 75 minutes).

secondary_outcome.description: This will be evaluated by interviewing the subject.
secondary_outcome.measure: Subject evaluation of the effect of taping on instability feelings.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute after the exercises (which last approximately 75 minutes).

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
